variant.question:
Which of the following statements regarding interpersonal interactions are correct? 
1. If the sender perceives that the receiver is incompetent, he/she will simplify the message

3. If the sender considers the receiver incompetent, he/she tends to simplify the content of the sentences 
4. It is much safer to fly with a crew who know each other well because communication will always be excellent. 
The correct statement(s) is (are):

options.text: 1 and 3 are correct
3 and 4 are correct
2 and 3 are correct
1 and 2 are correct

variant.question:
On March 29th 1977, at Tenerife Aifield, a Pan American and KLM aircraft were involved in a crash leading to multiple fatalities. On the day the visibility was severly restricted due to fog. The KLM aircraft received a flight clearance and the First Officer completed his readback with "we are now ready for take-off". The controller replied "OK, stand by for take-off". At this time there was a transmission from another aircraft on the frequency which interupted this message from the controller, the result being that the KLM crew only heard "OK". The KLM Captain interpreted "OK" as take-off clearance and started the take-off roll. The Pan Am aircraft was still taxing on the runway and the two collided. 
  
 In relation to this incident described above what type of communication and associated disadvantage are illustrated?

options.text: Explicit communication, since the message was interrupted and should have required clarification with the controller.
Implicit communication, which is prone to technical limitation such as multiple transmissions on the same frequency.
Explicit communication and as such open to interpretation by either the flight crew or controller.
Implicit communication which may be misinterpreted due to the fundamental differences between verbal and non verbal communication.

variant.question:
On March 29th 1977, at Tenerife Aifield, a Pan American and KLM aircraft were involved in a crash leading to multiple fatalities. On the day the visibility was severly restricted due to fog. The KLM aircraft received a flight clearance and the First Officer completed his readback with "we are now ready for take-off". The controller replied "OK, stand by for take-off". At this time there was a transmission from another aircraft on the frequency which interupted this message from the controller, the result being that the KLM crew only heard "OK". The KLM Captain interpreted "OK" as take-off clearance and started the take-off roll. The Pan Am aircraft was still taxing on the runway and the two collided.
In relation to this incident described above what type of communication and associated disadvantage are illustrated?

options.text: Explicit communication, since the message was interrupted and should have required clarification with the controller.
Implicit communication, which is prone to technical limitation such as multiple transmissions on the same frequency.
Explicit communication and as such open to interpretation by either the flight crew or controller.
Implicit communication which may be misinterpreted due to the fundamental differences between verbal and non verbal communication.

variant.question:
On March 29th 1977, at Tenerife, a Boeing 747 of Pan American and another of KLM were involved in the most fatal crash of the aviation history. On this day, the visibility was greatly reduced due to fog. 
The KLM 747 received a flight clearance. The First Officer finishes his reedback by saying "We are now ready for take-off". The controller replies "OK, stand-by for take-off". However, the crew of the KLM 747 only heard the part 'OK' because the rest of the sentence was cut off due to a transmission from another aircraft on the frequency (an interruption). The captain of the KLM 747 interpreted the 'OK' as a clearance for take-off and started the take-off roll.  But at the same time, the 747 of Pan Am was taxiing on the runway, leading to the fatal crash. 
What type of communication and associated disadvantage of are illustrated by the incident described above ?

options.text: Explicit communication, which since it got interrupted, should have required communication with the controller.
Implicit communication, which is prone to technical limitation such as multiple transmissions on the same frequency.
Explicit communication, which is always open to interpretation by either the flight crew or the controller.
Implicit communication, which can lead to confusion due to conflicts between the verbal and non-verbal communication.

is always clearly interpretable.
is used only if verbal clarity is not possible.
